page.title: 08DAIRY FARMING: BOWERCHALKE
page.content: One dairy herd of 145 cows and 25 'followers' is run on the 94 acres of the stipulated area. This is fertilised by farm effluent and chemicals. BREEDS - Friesian crossed with Canadian/Dutch Holstein. Artificial Insemination is used except for the heifers which run with a bull. In winter, cows are kept in modern housing in deep litter; from November cows remain outside in the daytime, only feeding on kale. They then have about 2 months under cover until early March, when they spend the days outside on rye and silage. By April, grass is suitable for 24hourly grazing. Feed is supplemented. "CONTRACT MILKING": One dairyman is employed. Milk is sold to the Milk Marketing Board direct. They carry out daily tests.Milk is top grade.
